specificName: Sizes and Scales Earth and Moon
educationalObjectives: Students will learn the relative scale of objects in the Earth Moon System
description: A demonstration of synchronous rotation of the Moon
author: John Wallin

objects.tmp: {"textField": "The View From Above the North Pole", "color": [255, 255, 255, 255], "fontSize": 1.0, "wrapText": false}
objects.name: sectionLabel

objectChanges.name: MainInstructions
objectChanges.canvasText:
In the lab handout, go to the section on the
'The View from Above the Earth.'  Once again, explore all the Moon Phases 
using the Next and Previous buttons.  

In the lab handout, sketch how the shadows on the Earth and Moon
appear from above the North Pole of Earth.  

When you finish looking at all the moon phases, a red Next Module
will appear.  Click on this button to go to the next module in this lab.
